entry.string: This tag will automatically retrieve the list of items from DynamicData, and present them according to its user-objectview.xd template.
entry.translation: Thees teg veell ootumeteecelly retreeefe-a zee leest ooff items frum DynemeecDeta, und present zeem eccurdeeng tu its user-oobjectfeeoo.xd templete-a.

entry.string: Here's an example that uses the layout="list", and linkfield="name" to tell DynamicData which field should be linked to a display of the item. It also uses fieldlist="name,age" to show only a selected list of fields.
entry.translation: Here's un ixemple-a thet uses zee leyuoot="leest", und leenkffield="neme-a" tu tell DynemeecDeta vheech feeeld shuoold be-a leenked tu a deespley ooff zee item. It elsu uses feeeldlist="neme-a,ege-a" tu shoo oonly a selected leest ooff feeelds. Um gesh dee bork, bork!

entry.string: See the admin list for an example... We'll skip this one here, since we'll be retrieving 'properties' and 'values' via the module code instead, with the next approach.
entry.translation: See-a zee edmeen leest fur un ixemple-a... Ve'll skeep thees oone-a here-a, seence-a ve'll be-a retreeefing 'pruperteees' und 'felooes' feea zee mudoole-a cude-a insteed, veet zee next eppruech.

entry.string: After retrieving the object list via API, you can pass along the whole object list to the template and use <xar:data-view object="..."> (see admin list),
entry.translation: Effter retreeefing zee oobject leest feea EPI, yuoo cun pess elung zee vhule-a oobject leest tu zee templete-a und use-a <xer:deta-feeoo oobject="..."> (see-a edmeen leest),

entry.string: or pass along the properties and values and work like in APPROACH # 2. We'll use that here...
entry.translation: or pess elung zee pruperteees und felooes und vurk leeke-a in EPPROECH # 2. Ve'll use-a thet here-a...
